subject: Decisions and Verdicts
lead_paragraph: Jurors in Atlanta found that Turner Broadcasting System, a unit of Time Warner Inc., improperly canceled a 2003 deal to sell the N.B.A.’s Atlanta Hawks and the N.H.L.’s Atlanta Thrashers to David McDavid, a former Dallas car dealer. The teams were bought by an Atlanta-based group of investors that included the son and son-in-law of TBS’s billionaire founder, Ted Turner. The $281 million verdict was the eighth largest in the United States this year and equal to about 6 percent of Time Warner’s 2007 net income of $4.39 billion.
